entry.value: table containing columns to be renamed
table containing two columns with the searched and replacement value in each row

Metanode renames columns in the upper table using the builtin KNIME node Column Rename (Regex).%%00010%%00010The bottom table (two specified columns from it) is used to define what should be searched ("Search string (regex)") and what should be used as Replacement to set up the internal Column Rename (Regex) node. The bottom table is used row-wise from the 1st row to the last one and all selected columns from the top table are passed to the Column Rename (Regex) node each time.%%00010%%00010The bottom table can be created e.g. by KNIME builtin node Table Creator.%%00010%%00010You can select, identically to the KNIME inbuilt "Column Rename (Regex)" node whether the searched value is of literal type and or whether the searched value should be treated case insensitevely.%%00010%%00010Please note:%%00010- "$" is used as special character here (fpr regular expressions) and needs to be escaped by (i.e. "\$") if it should be used as part of the Replacement text. If you want to search and replace this character, it should not be escaped though (i.e. use "$" only)%%00010- Columns order in the top table is not preserved if not all columns were selected to pass the renaming process. Not selected columns are present in the beginning of the resulting table, followed by the columns where the renamaning was done%%00010- extra column name suffix (e.g. " (#1)") is used in case the new column name is the same as already present column. This may happen in two scenarios - 1) when the renamed columns are appended to the columns not selected from the top table, and 2) during renaming step based on any row of the bottom table - i.e. new column name is the same as the name of other column selected from the top table. The latter case means the new column with extra column name suffix will be used for the following renaming steps.%%00010%%00010Please see builtin Column Rename (Regex) KNIME node for more information.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Component does not have input data, execute upstream nodes first
